results.title: Report for Colombo
results.brief_description: A report on the Colombo Plan, showing the services and facilities it is offering to the countries of south-east Asia. Shows visits of Indian, Pakistani and Ceylonese students and scientists to Australia; Asian students studying in Australian schools, technical colleges and universities; shipment of food, materials and equipment to south-east Asia.

results.title: Report
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Keith Gow and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
Indication of the dangers faced by employees jumping to incorrect conclusions based on second-hand and unreliable information from the Union delegate about management’s intentions.

results.title: Repo man
results.creator_credit: Michael Nesmith Productions, Edge City Productions, Jonathan Wacks, Peter McCarthy and Alex Cox
results.brief_description: A groundbreaking movie that introduced a punk sensibility to the film noir genre. Otto (Emilio Estevez) is a bored young man, just fired from his job in a supermarket, who meets up with a smooth-talking loner (Harry Dean Stanton) who recruits him as a “repo man”: a repossesor of cars because of default of payment. The strange plot involves aliens, Government spies and assorted punks and gangsters all searching for a 1964 Chevy Malibu which may hold the secret of life and death. The plot, however, doesn’t really matter. What does is the assured surreal landscape that Alex Cox discovers in the underbelly of suburban Los Angeles, and his irreverent experiments with genre. The LA of Repo Man is a disintegrating city, violent and alienated, but the film manages to undiscover a weird and sometimes eloquent beauty in the decay. The soundtrack, featuring US independant punk music from bands like Circle Jerks, Suicidal Tendencies, Black Flag and Iggy Pop is outstanding.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Nesmith Productions, Edge City Productions, Jonathan Wacks, Peter McCarthy and Alex Cox

results.title: Repetitive strain injuries at work
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Kim Dalton
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the reasons for repetitive strain injuries and discusses the symptoms and treatment of RSI. Sufferers describe the activities which led to their injuries and doctors talk about methods of prevention.
results.description: A documentary that examines the reasons for repetitive strain injuries and discusses the symptoms and treatment of RSI. Sufferers describe the activities which led to their injuries and doctors talk about methods of prevention.

results.title: Repeater away
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and David Haythornthwaite
results.brief_description: Shows the laying of the trans-Tasman circuit submarine telephone cable between New Zealand and Australia in 1976. Written and directed by David Haythornthwaite; photography Kerry Brown; sound Julian Ellingworth; commentary Peter Gwynne.

results.title: Repeat
results.brief_description:
First there was a white room, then a chair, a tv, a man. What is the natural order of things? This cleverly edited experimental video examines a variety of possible scenarios.
Graduate work from RMIT media arts (BA Arts)

results.title: Repairing Furniture
results.brief_description: Learn how to choose between white, yellow and hot hide glue, how to dissemble a piece safely and clean surfaces for glueing, how to clamp problem pieces, how to reglue or replace damaged veneer and how to mend broken parts and match missing mouldings.
results.description: Learn how to choose between white, yellow and hot hide glue, how to dissemble a piece safely and clean surfaces for glueing, how to clamp problem pieces, how to reglue or replace damaged veneer and how to mend broken parts and match missing mouldings.

results.title: Repairing an upholstered chair
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of how to mend an upholstered armchair when the seat is sagging or collapsed. A series of shots show the successive stages of building up the armchair on its wooden frame. Following this, a man is seen examining the seat of an armchair that needs repair. Work is started on the inverted chair, removing canvas and old webbing, refastening the springs, replacing the old webbing and stitching the springs to the new webbing, finally replacing the canvas cover. All stages of the operation are shown and explained.

results.title: Repairing a window pane
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of replacing a broken window pane. The film shows the tools required for the job and the whole process in order of procedure, taking out the sash of an upstairs window, measuring the pane, removing the old putty from the rebate and painting the bare wood exposed and fixing the new glass with putty.
